ai.summary: The +B39 South Diversion is a short, easy hike in the United Kingdom. Designed for beginners, this 1 km route offers a gentle walk along a diversion path with straightforward terrain and minimal elevation.
ai.terrain_summary: Flat to gently undulating paths on a well-maintained route. Surfaces include compact gravel, paved sections, and short grassy edges, making it accessible for walkers of all ages.
ai.safety_notes: Check local conditions before you go. Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing. Stay on marked paths and watch for any nearby road or canal edges. Bring a map or a charged phone, carry water, and let someone know your plans. If visibility is poor or surfaces are wet, take it slowly or turn back.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing and a light rain jacket
Map or fully charged phone with offline maps
ai.best_seasons: All year round; best in late spring to early autumn.

seo.title: +B39 South Diversion – Easy 1 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the +B39 South Diversion, a quick 1 km easy hike in the UK. Flat terrain, beginner-friendly route, and ideal for a relaxed outdoor outing.
